snippet: The provision suggested that a price-fixing investigation by the European Commission was gathering pace, years after the first raids were carried out.
abstract: Daimler is setting aside 600 million euros, or $748 million, to cover potential costs arising from European Union investigation into possible price fixing by Europe's biggest truck makers.
lead_paragraph: The provision suggested that a price-fixing investigation by the European Commission was gathering pace, years after the first raids were carried out.

headline.main: Daimler Sets Aside $748 Million Over E.U. Inquiry Into Truck Makers
headline.print_headline: Daimler Sets Aside Cash in Light of European Inquiry
